fields_of_interest: Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Review of EU Passenger Ship Safety legislation; MRV of ship emissions; EU Ship Recycling Regulation; ESSF (European Sustainable Shipping Forum)
organisation_name: International Association of Classification Societies Ltd. (IACS)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: European Sustainable Shipping Forum (ESSF)#E02869#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2869#Not a member#C#Air Emissions from Ships#High Level Steering Group for Governance of the Digital Maritime System and Services#E03450#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3450#Observer#C#Cooperation group on Places of Refuge#Stakeholders Advisory Group on Maritime Security #E01087#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1087#Member#C#Maritime Safety Group#E01079#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1079#Observer#C#Passenger Ship safety
goals__remit: Dedicated to safe ships and clean seas, IACS makes a unique contribution to maritime safety and regulation through technical support, compliance verification and research and development. More than 90% of the world's cargo carrying tonnage is covered by the classification design, construction and through-life compliance Rules and standards set by the thirteen Member Societies of IACS.
